reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Clarion was a good place to stay - it's located very close to the Skanstull stop on the underground, only 4 stops from the Central station. The breakfast buffet was brilliant for the range of foods offered (one of us is vegetarian, the other gluten free); as other reviews have mentioned, the buffet area did get pretty crowded, but it was fine. We were in a standard double with plenty of space in the room, very comfortable. We'd happily recommend it to friends and family.
reviews.title: Loved Stockholm & The Clarion!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very stylish, it felt like being a superstar or James Bond. Delicious breakfast, although quite crowdy. Tram Station close by, we still think back to our trip and reading the other reviews it luckily hasn´t changed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We definitely enjoyed our stay at the Clarion Hotel. The design of the hotel is well-done, stylish, but not overdone. The location is great - very close to lots of trendy shops and bars on Södermalm and the metro station Skanstull. A highlight was the breakfast with Swedish (herring) and international (pancakes, Miso soup) delicacies.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I've been traveling Stockholm for business and leisure for a couple of years now. Have been staying at Clarion Stockholm for at least 5-10 times now, so it's time I give this review to show my appreciation. This review will be a bit like a rollercoaster ride, cause I do love the hotel for it's atmosphere, but as I wrote it, I realized it has a couple of cons too.
reviews.title: Great location...........Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Clarion Stockholm is hip, stylish, modern and awesome. It's not a hotel, it's a space that's being consumed to it's full extent, ranging from conference rooms to bands playing in the bar on Friday nights. What I love about Clarion is the fact that it has put the living in the first place and the sleeping in the second. Clarion Hotel Stockholm has two bars, one lobby bar that's one of the best meeting spaces in Stockholm for business meetings, and one "upstairs bar", where you can grab the most delicious cocktails any day. It also hosts Greta's Restaurant, which frankly, is not the best restaurant offered in Stockholm, but is really nice, has a rather cool view and great servers that make up for the gap in exciting dishes that they serve.
reviews.title: Here are the basics

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009
reviews.text: Let's re-start this; already when you enter the hotel it's a large lobby that always has some nice Clarion Living music giving you the best mood possible. The lobby bar serves drinks and coffee, where the atmosphere and the environment makes it great, while the drinks are better in the upstairs bar and the coffee is better on the coffee shops located nearby the hotel. But that doesn't really matter, atmosphere covers what the drinks and coffee lacks.
reviews.title: Very Arty

description: At Clarion Hotel Stockholm guests can enjoy a modern hotel with art and music and design as part of it's integral character. Be inspired and enjoy the hotel’s unique pulse and surroundings with our Asian-fusion restaurant "Minami", lobby bar, Upstairs Bar, and our heavenly Ayurveda-inspired "Elements Spa".It is not however just about fantastic food, spectacular art displays, great music, or mingling. Our passion and focus is on providing you with a wonderful night’s sleep and increasing your quality of life. Choose from our 532 rooms and luxurious suites that best suit your needs. We look forward to welcoming you and giving you a stay to remember.
